intro: Impatiens blumei, commonly known as the Mexican impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are spurred at the base, a distinctive feature of the genus Impatiens, and it thrives in moist, shady environments.
